intro: Peristrophe dalaora, commonly known as the African grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval seeds. Peristrophe dalaora is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
